long_desc.thetext:
When scrolling in a table (with the vertical scroll bar), the content 'jumps' line by line. This works, the begaviour is like MS-Excel.
But: It would be nice, if the scrolling would be pixel-by-pixel. With such a scrolling-mechanism, the user-experience is much better, because he can 'visually' follow the data better and so he can 'stop' scrolling more accurate.
I know that the table-widget has to render 'half-visible' table-lines on to. But perhaps this is not a big problem, as it nowadays already can render 'half-lines' at the bottom of a table (when the table-height is not exactly a multiple of one line-height).

The table already supports this feature. It has the property keepFirstVisibleRowComplete <http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/apiviewer/#qx.ui.table.Table~keepFirstVisibleRowComplete>, which is true by default. If you set this property to true the table will use smooth scrolling.
